page.title: 05Memories of High Lane - 1920
page.content: We interviewed a lady called Mrs.Lees. She was 77 years old and has lived in{High Lane}all her life. She could remember when the A6, which is now a very busy road (over 800 vehicles an hour), was so quiet that all the children played on it. All the side roads were empty and had no houses on them, they were dirt tracks which they would play marbles on. Mrs.Lee lived opposite the{Court house and could remember the time when the cells were used. She went to the old village school and when she was 11 she started to work part-time at the mill in Marple. When she was 14 she left school to work full time at the mill. Other people in{High Lane}either worked at the same mill, on the farms, at Lyme Hall, or at a printer's in Disley.
